div.div:
updated April 17, 2020 pm - Per Governor Abbott’s mandate, Valley school will continue distance learning for the rest of the 2019-2020 school year. We are missing our students and are anxious for the time we can come back together! God bless you...and stay safe!
We thank you...teachers, students, staff, and community...for your assistance in making this instructional transition a success!

div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 13:54 pm CDT

div.div: Showers likely, mainly before 3pm. Cloudy, with a high near 63. North wind 11 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.

A 30 percent chance of showers, mainly before 7pm. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming mostly clear, with a low around 43. North northeast wind 10 to 15 mph becoming light north northwest after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 22 mph. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.

A slight chance of showers between 8am and 2pm, then a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms after 2pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 68. Light north northwest wind increasing to 5 to 10 mph in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

div.p:
Valley Patriot Meal Plan
Valley School will provide meals for ALL students, free of charge, beginning Wednesday, March 25th through April 3rd with extensions based on any further delays based on the COVID-19 situation. Meals will be delivered to households. Food will be delivered from 9:00 a.m. - 11:00 a.m. Monday-Friday. Breakfast and lunch for each student will be delivered.
